content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
Consists of:
– A furnace used to smelt iron ore with coal into iron plates, supporting the production chain needed for lab crafting.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of:
– A furnace used to smelt copper ore with coal into copper plates, which are required for copper cable production and ultimately for lab crafting components.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– API Usage and Entity Retrieval:
 • When calling get_entities, use the correct parameters. Calls with an unexpected keyword (such as “radius”) or excessive positional arguments lead to TypeErrors.
 • Guard against None returns by using a fallback (e.g. an empty list) to prevent iteration errors.

– Lab Placement and Crafting:
 • Verify that the lab blueprint exists in the inventory before attempting placement; failures occurred when no lab was available.
 • Confirm that all required sub-ingredients for lab crafting (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available. Ensure that upstream production (smelting and crafting of necessary plates and components) is in place to meet these requirements.

– Resource Management:
 • Monitor critical resource levels prior to initiating crafting or smelting operations to avoid shortages that trigger repeated crafting errors.
